section.title: Overview
section.abstract: The distinction between matters of logic and matters of fact provides a starting point for analytic philosophy and sound reason.

section.title: Introduction
section.abstract:
The evolution of the analytic/synthetic distinction, over a period of more than 2000 years, provides an example of how progress in philosophy takes place and of how that progress might be thought to contribute to progress for humanity.
This is one perspective on the story.

center.blockquote:
I am preparing a short monograph on this topic intended for publication as a POD paperback.
Though I have definite ideas about what I want to do in the monograph,
I am hoping to involve others in its creation through philosophical discussion and debate.
These pages provide access to drafts of the monograph in various forms and to other related materials.

subsec.title: Presentations of The Monograph
subsec.p: Several different formats of document are generated from the sources of the monograph. These different forms have the same content so you may read whichever format you find most convenient. All except the paperback book format are provided for you to read or download for reading from this web site at no cost, and you are granted permission only to read them, not to make any other use of them. All formats will be available for drafts from the earliest stages of writing the monograph, with the sole exception of the paperpack format, which will become available only when the monograph is deemed complete (-enough for the first edition).

The available formats are:
HTML (produced by LaTeX2HTML)
A4 PDF two-column pamphlet
A link for buying the paperback from amazon will be included when the monograph has been published.

sbcol.subsec: I have a variety of other material on this topic which I am developing concurrently with the monograph. Some of these provide additional detail and discussion or background, others present the material in different ways.
I will be discussing the monograph with all comers on the hist-analytic mailing list (see archives) througout the writing, from the very earliest stages. To subscribe see hist-analytic.org.
Philosophy is reknown, often contrasted with mathematics, for the inconstancy of its dogmas, for having sustained almost every conceivable opinion and many beyond belief.
